metadata.title: Effect of Mesoscale Anticyclonic Eddies on the Hydrochemical Structure of the Bering Sea
metadata.description:
The paper presents data showing the effect of mesoscale eddies on the
     distribution of phosphates, nitrates, ammonia nitrogen, organic phosphorus
     and nitrogen in the Bering Sea. An important role is played by powerful
     anticyclonic eddies along the edge of the continental slope. Water 'slips' over
     the slope sometimes down to depths of 600-1000 m and reaches the oxygen
     minimum layer. Under these conditions renewal of water in the oxygen
     minimum layer and upwelling of deep water in the adjacent cyclonic eddies
     take place. The new data call for revision of earlier ideas on the rate of vertical
     surface, intermediate and deep water exchange.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To show the effect of mesoscale anticyclonic eddies on the hydrochemical structure of the Bering Sea.
